trans-unit.source: Lines FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Lines FastTab

trans-unit.source: The Lines FastTab contains two menus: Functions and Line. The menu items for each are explained in the following sections.

seg-source.mrk: The Lines FastTab contains two menus: Functions and Line.
The menu items for each are explained in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Functions Menu

seg-source.mrk: Functions Menu

trans-unit.source: The menu items on the Functions menu relate to the selected line. Each function is described in the following sections.

seg-source.mrk: The menu items on the Functions menu relate to the selected line.
Each function is described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Move

seg-source.mrk: Move

trans-unit.source: This function moves the selected production orders before or behind the current position. After the move, all production orders are rescheduled that are currently in planning in the work center.

seg-source.mrk: This function moves the selected production orders before or behind the current position.
After the move, all production orders are rescheduled that are currently in planning in the work center.

trans-unit.source: To mark production orders to move, select the orders by clicking the line while pressing the CTRL key. The last line selected is where the first marked orders are moved.

seg-source.mrk: To mark production orders to move, select the orders by clicking the line while pressing the CTRL key.
The last line selected is where the first marked orders are moved.

trans-unit.source: Reverse

seg-source.mrk: Reverse

trans-unit.source: This function reverses planned production orders. The production order is moved to the end of the sequence in the work center and then all other planned production orders are rescheduled.

seg-source.mrk: This function reverses planned production orders.
The production order is moved to the end of the sequence in the work center and then all other planned production orders are rescheduled.

trans-unit.source: : Reversed production order lines

seg-source.mrk: : Reversed production order lines

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: During the “Reverse” process, planned maintenance-/setup jobs are deleted.

seg-source.mrk: During the “Reverse” process, planned maintenance-/setup jobs are deleted.

trans-unit.source: Change Work Center

seg-source.mrk: Change Work Center

trans-unit.source: This function changes the work center on a sequence order. Initially, a list of all sequence work centers is displayed in the Work Center List page.

seg-source.mrk: This function changes the work center on a sequence order.
Initially, a list of all sequence work centers is displayed in the Work Center List page.

trans-unit.source: : Work Center List

seg-source.mrk: : Work Center List

trans-unit.source: In this page, select the work center to where the current production order in the sequence planning is moved. After clicking OK, the following message appears.

seg-source.mrk: In this page, select the work center to where the current production order in the sequence planning is moved.
After clicking OK, the following message appears.

trans-unit.source: : Message to change the Work Center on the production order line

seg-source.mrk: : Message to change the Work Center on the production order line

trans-unit.source: After accepting the message, the production order line is moved to the new work center. The production orders of the current work center will be re-scheduled.

seg-source.mrk: After accepting the message, the production order line is moved to the new work center.
The production orders of the current work center will be re-scheduled.

trans-unit.source: : Production order line moved from work center M002 to M001

seg-source.mrk: : Production order line moved from work center M002 to M001

trans-unit.source: During the work center change, all current production rates are considered. If the new item/work center combination has different production rates, they are used and stored in the routing sheet.

seg-source.mrk: During the work center change, all current production rates are considered.
If the new item/work center combination has different production rates, they are used and stored in the routing sheet.

trans-unit.source: The work center is also changed in the routing sheet.

seg-source.mrk: The work center is also changed in the routing sheet.

trans-unit.source: : Production order routing with updated work center information

seg-source.mrk: : Production order routing with updated work center information

trans-unit.source: In addition to the production rates, the work center costs are updated.

seg-source.mrk: In addition to the production rates, the work center costs are updated.

trans-unit.source: Change Tool

seg-source.mrk: Change Tool

trans-unit.source: Generally, the change of tools is like the change of a work center. A list of available tools that can be changed is displayed.

seg-source.mrk: Generally, the change of tools is like the change of a work center.
A list of available tools that can be changed is displayed.

trans-unit.source: During the change process, the tool is changed in the routing sheet and new costs and production rates are recalculated.

seg-source.mrk: During the change process, the tool is changed in the routing sheet and new costs and production rates are recalculated.

trans-unit.source: Change Insert

seg-source.mrk: Change Insert

trans-unit.source: Generally, the change of inserts is like the change of a work center. A list of available inserts that can be changed is displayed.

seg-source.mrk: Generally, the change of inserts is like the change of a work center.
A list of available inserts that can be changed is displayed.

trans-unit.source: During the change process, the insert is changed in the routing sheet and new costs and production rates are recalculated.

seg-source.mrk: During the change process, the insert is changed in the routing sheet and new costs and production rates are recalculated.

trans-unit.source: Split Prod. Order Line

seg-source.mrk: Split Prod.
Order Line

trans-unit.source: This function splits production order lines into multiple production orders and approaches. For more information, refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Split Production Orders.htm#_Ref415832819" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Split Production Orders” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: This function splits production order lines into multiple production orders and approaches.

For more information, refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Split Production Orders.htm#_Ref415832819" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Split Production Orders” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: Combine Prod. Order Line

seg-source.mrk: Combine Prod.
Order Line

trans-unit.source: This function combines several production orders into one production order. For more information, refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Combine Production Orders.htm#_Ref368573236" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Combine Production Orders” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: This function combines several production orders into one production order.

For more information, refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Combine Production Orders.htm#_Ref368573236" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Combine Production Orders” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: Change Status

seg-source.mrk: Change Status

trans-unit.source: This standard manufacturing function in Microsoft Dynamics NAV is used in the Sequence Planning to change the status of one or more production orders. To change several production orders, each must have the same status. Multiple orders can be selected by clicking the line while pressing the CTRL key.

seg-source.mrk: This standard manufacturing function in Microsoft Dynamics NAV is used in the Sequence Planning to change the status of one or more production orders.
To change several production orders, each must have the same status.
Multiple orders can be selected by clicking the line while pressing the CTRL key.

trans-unit.source: : Change status dialog

seg-source.mrk: : Change status dialog

trans-unit.source: Select the relevant status (to which this production order is to be assigned) and the appropriate Posting Date.

seg-source.mrk: Select the relevant status (to which this production order is to be assigned) and the appropriate Posting Date.

trans-unit.source: To update the unit cost of the item that is produced, select the Update Unit Cost check box. The unit cost of the item will also be updated in any production orders or sales orders for which this item has been reserved.

seg-source.mrk: To update the unit cost of the item that is produced, select the Update Unit Cost check box.
The unit cost of the item will also be updated in any production orders or sales orders for which this item has been reserved.

trans-unit.source: Planning Maintenance-/Setup Job

seg-source.mrk: Planning Maintenance-/Setup Job

trans-unit.source: During the planning of a maintenance and setup job, a list of all maintenance and setup job types is displayed. From this list, predefined maintenance and setup jobs may be selected.

seg-source.mrk: During the planning of a maintenance and setup job, a list of all maintenance and setup job types is displayed.
From this list, predefined maintenance and setup jobs may be selected.

trans-unit.source: : List of Maintenance / Setup Job Types

seg-source.mrk: : List of Maintenance / Setup Job Types

trans-unit.source: This function moves the new maintenance-/setup job before or after the current production order. After the move, a new maintenance-/setup job is created for the current work center. For more information, refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Maintenance Setup Job Types.htm#_Ref415832853" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Maintenance-/Setup Job Types” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: This function moves the new maintenance-/setup job before or after the current production order.
After the move, a new maintenance-/setup job is created for the current work center.

For more information, refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Maintenance Setup Job Types.htm#_Ref415832853" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Maintenance-/Setup Job Types” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: Set Start Order

seg-source.mrk: Set Start Order

trans-unit.source: If no production order has been planned for a work center in the sequence planning (all sequence positions are 999,999,999,999), one order must be set as the start order.

seg-source.mrk: If no production order has been planned for a work center in the sequence planning (all sequence positions are 999,999,999,999), one order must be set as the start order.

trans-unit.source: When the “Set Start Order” function is run, the Sequence Pl. Start dialog box appears. In the Start Date and Start Time fields, enter the point of time on which the current production order should be scheduled to.

seg-source.mrk: When the “Set Start Order” function is run, the <span class="Bold">Sequence Pl.
Start dialog box appears.
In the Start Date and Start Time fields, enter the point of time on which the current production order should be scheduled to.

trans-unit.source: These fields are automatically filled in with the current time and date. If the production is planned to a certain date or, for example to the beginning of a shift, these fields must be modified. By clicking OK, the selected production order only is rescheduled.

seg-source.mrk: These fields are automatically filled in with the current time and date.
If the production is planned to a certain date or, for example to the beginning of a shift, these fields must be modified.
By clicking OK, the selected production order only is rescheduled.

trans-unit.source: Line Menu

seg-source.mrk: Line Menu

trans-unit.source: The menu items on the Line menu relate to the selected line. Each function is described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The menu items on the Line menu relate to the selected line.
Each function is described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Menu Item

seg-source.mrk: Menu Item

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Prod. Order

seg-source.mrk: Prod.
Order

trans-unit.source: Opens the Production Order of the selected production order line.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Production Order of the selected production order line.

trans-unit.source: Item Availability by

seg-source.mrk: Item Availability by

trans-unit.source: Contains a drop-down list with the following menu items:

seg-source.mrk: Contains a drop-down list with the following menu items:

trans-unit.source: Event

seg-source.mrk: Event

trans-unit.source: Location

seg-source.mrk: Location

trans-unit.source: Period

seg-source.mrk: Period

trans-unit.source: Lot

seg-source.mrk: Lot

trans-unit.source: Variant

seg-source.mrk: Variant

trans-unit.source: BOM Level

seg-source.mrk: BOM Level

trans-unit.source: These options check the availability of the item that is currently produced.

seg-source.mrk: These options check the availability of the item that is currently produced.

trans-unit.source: Reservation Entries

seg-source.mrk: Reservation Entries

trans-unit.source: Opens the Reservation Entries page, which contains one entry for each manually or automatically created reservation of the current production order line.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Reservation Entries page, which contains one entry for each manually or automatically created reservation of the current production order line.

trans-unit.source: Dimensions

seg-source.mrk: Dimensions

trans-unit.source: When a production order, a production order line, or a production order component is created, document dimension values can be added that can be used later in the analysis. For two shortcut dimensions, the dimension values may be entered directly in a production order, a production order line, or a production order component.

seg-source.mrk: When a production order, a production order line, or a production order component is created, document dimension values can be added that can be used later in the analysis.
For two shortcut dimensions, the dimension values may be entered directly in a production order, a production order line, or a production order component.

trans-unit.source: Values for dimensions that are not available in a production order, a production order line, or a production order component, can be entered in this page.

seg-source.mrk: Values for dimensions that are not available in a production order, a production order line, or a production order component, can be entered in this page.

trans-unit.source: Manufacturing Dimensions

seg-source.mrk: Manufacturing Dimensions

trans-unit.source: On creation of production order lines, the default manufacturing dimensions from the item are transferred to the production order line. If the production order lines are sequence planned, the default manufacturing dimensions from the possibly existing sequence work center, tool or insert are transferred to the production order line as well.

seg-source.mrk: On creation of production order lines, the default manufacturing dimensions from the item are transferred to the production order line.

If the production order lines are sequence planned, the default manufacturing dimensions from the possibly existing sequence work center, tool or insert are transferred to the production order line as well.

trans-unit.source: The Priority field in the Manufacturing Dimension Setup page defines the order of the different default manufacturing dimensions to transfer (refer to topic “Manufacturing Dimension Priority” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: The Priority field in the Manufacturing Dimension Setup page defines the order of the different default manufacturing dimensions to transfer (refer to topic “Manufacturing Dimension Priority” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Example

seg-source.mrk: Example

trans-unit.source: The item and the work center in a production order line have the same default manufacturing dimension. Only the default manufacturing dimension value of the type with the highest priority in the manufacturing dimension setup is transferred to the production order line.

seg-source.mrk: The item and the work center in a production order line have the same default manufacturing dimension.
Only the default manufacturing dimension value of the type with the highest priority in the manufacturing dimension setup is transferred to the production order line.

trans-unit.source: Routing

seg-source.mrk: Routing

trans-unit.source: Opens the Prod. Order Routing page for the selected production order line, where users can enter routing sheets before or after a resource sequence.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the <span class="Bold">Prod.
Order Routing page for the selected production order line, where users can enter routing sheets before or after a resource sequence.

trans-unit.source: Components

seg-source.mrk: Components

trans-unit.source: Opens the Prod. Order Components page, where substitution items can be checked and replaced, and new components for the production order can be entered manually.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the <span class="Bold">Prod.
Order Components page, where substitution items can be checked and replaced, and new components for the production order can be entered manually.

trans-unit.source: Components Planning Pool

seg-source.mrk: Components Planning Pool

trans-unit.source: Opens the Components Planning Pool page, where the availability of components can also be checked in the planning pool (refer to topic “Components Planning Pool” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Components Planning Pool page, where the availability of components can also be checked in the planning pool (refer to topic “Components Planning Pool” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Item Tracking Lines

seg-source.mrk: Item Tracking Lines

trans-unit.source: Opens the Item Tracking Lines page, used to track planned items that are Lot No. / Serial No. tracked.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Item Tracking Lines page, used to track planned items that are Lot No.
/ Serial No.
tracked.

trans-unit.source: Show used Work Center Production Rate

seg-source.mrk: Show used Work Center Production Rate

trans-unit.source: Opens the Work Center Prod. Rate Card page for sequence planned production order lines to show the Work Center Production Rates used to calculate the setup and run times of a production order routing line.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the <span class="Bold">Work Center Prod.
Rate Card page for sequence planned production order lines to show the Work Center Production Rates used to calculate the setup and run times of a production order routing line.

trans-unit.source: If this function is run on a sequence planning line without a Work Center Production Rate, a message will appear.

seg-source.mrk: If this function is run on a sequence planning line without a Work Center Production Rate, a message will appear.

trans-unit.source: Show Capacity Warning

seg-source.mrk: Show Capacity Warning

trans-unit.source: Opens the Capacity Conflict Log page, which shows all capacity warnings for the current production order (refer to topic “Visualize Capacity Currently Utilized on Work Centers/Tools” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Capacity Conflict Log page, which shows all capacity warnings for the current production order (refer to topic “Visualize Capacity Currently Utilized on Work Centers/Tools” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Calculation

seg-source.mrk: Calculation

trans-unit.source: Contains the Calculation (Expected) and Calculation (Actual) options. Refer to topic “cc|calculation” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Contains the Calculation (Expected) and Calculation (Actual) options.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="cc calculation.htm#_Toc434256779" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“cc|calculation” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Production Journal

seg-source.mrk: Production Journal

trans-unit.source: The production journal is standard manufacturing functionality in Microsoft Dynamics NAV but has been enhanced with some cc|process manufacturing features. For more information about the cc|process manufacturing-related functionality, refer to topic “Production Journal” on page 1.

seg-source.mrk: The production journal is standard manufacturing functionality in Microsoft Dynamics NAV but has been enhanced with some cc|process manufacturing features.
For more information about the cc|process manufacturing-related functionality, refer to topic “Production Journal” on page 1.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the standard functionality, refer to the Production Order Processing content in the current Microsoft Dynamics NAV Manufacturing training material.

seg-source.mrk: For more information about the standard functionality, refer to the Production Order Processing content in the current Microsoft Dynamics NAV Manufacturing training material.
